isis.stitle: ALTERNATOR: DELCO-REMY 21-SI SERIES - MAGNETIZING THE ROTOR

svcproc.title: MAGNETIZING THE ROTOR
svcproc.para: The rotor should be remagnetized if the alternator has no output, or after rebuilding.

Residual magnetism in the rotor is sometimes lost during servicing of the alternator. Utilizing the "R" terminal, the rotor can be remagnetized without removing the alternator from the vehicle. To remagnetize rotor, make sure the normal connections are made to the alternator "BAT" terminal and to the ground circuit. Disconnect the wire (if present) from the "R" terminal. Momentarily connect a jumper lead from battery positive post to the alternator "R" terminal. This will cause field current to momentarily flow through the rotor in the proper direction and restore magnetism. Reconnect wire (if present) to the "R" terminal, then recheck alternator for output.
